data.title: Fun Trivia – Swarasinger
data.meta_description: Posts about Fun Trivia written by swaraswami93
data.text:
Hello everyone! So today is A.R Rahman’s birthday! He has composed so many hit songs that were brilliant! But there have been some songs that were too good, but they didn’t make it big! So here I am going to write about the list of underrated songs by A.R Rahman!

Kabhi Na Kabhi

This album is a must-listen! One of the best albums I have ever come across. Each and every song is wonderful! Very brilliantly composed! Sadly this album didn’t make it big due to the movie being a flop! But I would definitely suggest you guys to listen to this album! If you don’t, then you guys are missing out on one of the best albums!

One fact about this movie is that the song ‘Mil Gayi Mil Gayi’ is the Hindi version of ‘Anjali Anjali’ from ‘Duet’ (composed by A.R Rahman). This was sung by Kumar Sanu, the first and only song he sang for A.R Rahman.

2. Doli Saja Ke Rakhna

Another wonderful yet underrated album by A.R Rahman! Each songs are wonderful and heart-touching! But this again didn’t make it big due to the movie being a flop!

3. Kadhalar Dhinam/Dil Hi Dil Mein

Again one of the best albums by A.R Rahman, which I thought deserved to be at the very top! Even the Hindi version of the album is as good as the original one. Especially listen to the song Ennai Villai Azhaghe/Ae Nazneen Suno Na.

4. Zubeidaa

Oh this album is a masterpiece! Each and every song is mesmerizing! Again, this album didn’t make it big when it deserves to be at the top! But I would suggest everyone to listen to this album! It is one of the best albums by A.R Rahman.

5. Swades

For me, this album is brilliance! Another wonderful A.R Rahman album which deserved to be at the top! The songs ‘Yeh Jo Des Hai Tera’ and ‘Yun Hi Chala’ were hits but the rest of album songs were also wonderful! Must-listen to this album!

6. The Legend of Bhagat Singh

Not only the songs are wonderful, so are the background music! Again another wonderfully composed album by A.R Rahman which is a must-listen!

7. 1947 Earth

This album was just wonderful! I felt it could’ve been a hit album! ‘Ruth Aa Gayi Re’ and ‘Dheemi Dheemi’ were just mind-blowing! Must listen to this album!

8. Tehzeeb

Another album which I found very unique and underrated! Each lyrics consisted of traditional poems of famous poets! Must-listen to this album!

9. Udhaya

A must-listen album by A.R Rahman! Each song is mesmerizing that it deserves to go to the top! The title song is a must listen!

10. Meenaxi: A Tale of Three Cities

All the songs were mesmerizing, and so were the background music! While the songs ‘Yeh Rishta’ and ‘Chinnamma’ were noticed, the rest of the songs weren’t noticed, while they were too good! Must listen album!

11. Lakeer

A.R Rahman has re-used three songs from ‘Rhythm’, which is one of my favourite albums! But still he made those three songs sound wonderful! The rest of the songs were amazing too! Definitely one of the most underrated albums by A.R Rahman!

Fact: The song ‘Rozana’ is the first film song by Viva for A.R Rahman.

12.Mangal Pandey- The Rising

This movie wasn’t a hit, hence the songs also couldn’t make it big sadly! But the songs were too good! Especially ‘Main Vari Vari’ and ‘Rasiya’! Must-listen to this album!

13. Alive- Provoked

Another beautiful yet underrated song of A.R Rahman! Karen David sung it beautifully! Have a listen!

14.Yuvvraaj

I came across this album just recently! Have to say that this is one of the most underrated albums of A.R Rahman! While the song ‘Tu Meri Dost Hai’ was a chartbuster, the rest of the songs didn’t make it that big, when they were so mesmerizing! Manmohini Morey is a must-listen!

15. Taxi Taxi – Sakkarakatti

Sakkarakatti might be my least favourite album by A.R Rahman, but this song is definitely one of my favourites! Benny Dayal sang wonderfully! Must-listen!

16. Blue

I have to admit that I actually like this soundtrack! Except for ‘Chiggy Wiggy’ which I found too mainstream, I liked all the other songs! ‘Fiqrana’, ‘Rehnuma’ and ‘Bhoola Tujhe’ are a must-listen!

17. Couples Retreat

Another wonderful album which wasn’t noticed due to the movie not becoming a hit! Especially the song ‘Sajna’ is a must listen!

18. 127 Hours

Mesmerizing album by A.R Rahman, which I felt deserved much more! ‘If I Rise’ is a beautiful song! must listen!

19. Million Dollar Arm

This album just came out last year, and this is one of the best albums that I came across! The song ‘We Could Be Kings’ sung by KT Tunstall is too mesmerizing! Must listen to the album!

20. The Hundred-Foot Journey

Another wonderful album, which I felt should have received appreciation! It definitely deserved to be nominated for the oscars, but sadly it didn’t! But must listen to the soundtrack, especially ‘Afreen’!

21. Ada.. A Way of Life

A.R Rahman had composed songs for this movie before Lagaan. This is one of the most underrated and wonderful albums of A.R Rahman! Sadly this soundtrack went unnoticed. Must listen to this album, especially ‘Ishq Ada’

22. Water

Another wonderful yet underrated album of A.R Rahman! Each song is mesmerizing! Especially listen to ‘Aayo Re Sajan Sakhi’!

Then there were some songs from hit soundtracks, that were underrated!

23. Dil Gira Daftan and Rehna Tu – Delhi 6

While this movie had a lot of hit songs like ‘Masakalli’, ‘Genda Phool’, ‘Arziyan’, ‘Delhi-6’, these two songs according to me are the most underrated in this album! These 2 songs are very heart-touching! Must-listen!

24. Manmohana – Jodha Akbar

While this movie had a lot of hit songs like ‘Jashn-E-Bahaara’ and ‘Khwaja Mera Khwaja’, this song according to me is so beautiful and heart-touching! Wonderful composition and singing! Must-listen to this song!

25. Naina Milaike and Mere Yaar Mila De – Saathiya

These were the only 2 songs that wasn’t reused from Alaipayuthey! While Saathiya was a hit album, these 2 songs were underrated! These were 2 beautiful songs that are a must listen!

26. Kismat Se Tum and Ek Tu Hi Bharosa – Pukar

While the songs ‘Key Sera Sera’ and ‘Sunta Hai Mera Khuda’ were huge hits, these two songs I felt, were underrated! these 2 songs really captured my heart! must listen!

27. Liquid Dance, Gangsta Blues and Mausam and Escape – Slumdog Millionaire

While ‘Jai Ho,’ O Saya’ and ‘Dreams on Fire’ were huge hits, these songs didn’t become huge hits, when they deserved! These songs were breathtaking! Must listen!

28. Tango for Taj and the Dichotomy of Fame – Rockstar

While songs like ‘Sadda Haq’, ‘Tum Ho’ and ‘Kun Faya Kun’ were huge hits, these songs were underrated! These 2 are beautiful instrumental music, that would just capture your heart!

29. Anbendra/ Roshan Huyi Raat – Minsara Kanavu/ Sapnay

Minsara Kanavu/Sapnay was a hit soundtrack! But I felt this song wasn’t noticed enough when it is one of the best songs composed by A.R Rahman! Must listen!

30. Nagamani Nagamani/ Rukumani Rukumani- Roja

Roja again was a hit album of A.R Rahman! However, I felt that this song was slightly underrated when it could have been at the top as well! Wonderful composition!

Then there are albums which were too good, but have sadly been forgotten.

31. Taj Mahal

This is one of my favourite albums by A.R Rahman! But since the movie didn’t become a hit, the songs became forgotten! Anyways this is a must-listen album! All the songs are mesmerizing!

32. Sangamam

There was a time when these songs were a hit, but since the movie flopped, the songs have been forgotten! this is one of the best albums by A.R Rahman! each song is so mesmerizing, that it touches your heart! Have a listen!

For now this is all I can remember! If you know any other song of A.R Rahman which you thought was underrated, let me know and I will add that! Meanwhile please listen to these songs! They are a must!

Like Bollywood and Hollywood, even in Kollywood there were films in which these actors weren’t the original choice. Lets check out the list of actors who were the original choice for these popular Kollywood films.

1) Indian

Aishwarya Rai was initially offered to play female lead, but she turned it down and hence the role went to Manisha Koirala. Raadhika was offered to play the other lead opposite the older Kamal Hassan, but she turned it down and the role went to Sukanya.

2) Meaghamann

Shruti Hassan was offered to play the female lead, but she reportedly turned it down. Taapsee Pannu was also offered, but the role went to Hansika.

3) Aranmanai

Apparently Arya was offered the male lead, but the role went to Vinay Rai. Lakshmi Rai’s role was initially offered to Ragini Dwivedi, but she turned it down.

4) Kochadaiyaan

Anushka Shetty was initially offered to play the female lead, but she turned it down. Several actresses such as Asin, Vidya Balan and even Katrina Kaif were approached, but the role finally went to Deepika Padukone.

5) Thuppakki

Deepika Padukone was initially offered the female lead, but she refused. Several actresses such as Sonam Kapoor, Priya Anand, Pranitha, Angela Jonsson were also offered, but the role finally went to Kajal Aggarwal.

6) Oru Kal Oru Kannadi

Asin and Nayanthara were initially offered to play the female lead, but the role went to Hansika Motwani.

7) Enthiran

Several actresses such as Priyanka Chopra, Deepika Padukone, Asin, Trisha, Priyamani, Nayanthara, Shriya Saran etc, were also considered to play the female lead, but the role went to Aishwarya Rai. Amitabh Bachchan, J.D Chakravarthy, Narain and Arjun were originally considered for the antagonist role, but the role went to Danny Denzongpa.

8) Arrambam

Anushka Shetty, Amala Paul and Kajal Aggarwal were all considered for the lead female role, but the role went to Nayanthara. Arya’s role was initially offered to Vishnuvardhan’s brother Kreshna, but he refused and thus Arya got the role. Richa Gangopadhyay was offered to play the female role opposite Arya, but the role went to Taapsee Pannu.

9) Raja Rani

The role of Surya was initially offered to Sivakarthikeyan, but the role went to Jai, which made him popular. The role of Keerthana was originally offered to Priya Anand, but the role went to Nazriya Nazim.

10) Billa (2007)

Isha Sharwani was also considered for the female role, but she lost out to Nayanthara. The other female role was initially offered to Shriya Saran, but she refused. Other actresses such as Trisha, Reemma Sen, Asin and Bhanu were also considered, then the role went to Pooja Umashankar. But Pooja refused the role as she didn’t want to wear a bikini and hence the role went to Namitha. Prakash Raj was offered the role of an inspector, but the role went to Prabhu, Vadivelu was originally offered to play the comedian, but the role went to Santhanam. The dance number was originally offered to Mumaith Khan, but later Rose Dawn (now known as Hazel Keech) got it.

11) Raavanan

Abhishek Bachchan was initially offered to play Aishwarya Rai’s husband, the cop while Vikram played Veera. But Abhishek Bachchan refused as he was unfamiliar with the language. Hence the role went to Prithviraj.

12) Goa

Genelia D’souza was offered to play the female role opposite Jai, but she refused. Amrita Rao’s sister Preetika Rao (who was last seen in the TV serial Beintehaa) was also approached, but she backed out at the last minute. The role went to Pooja, and later she was replaced by Piaa Bajpai.

13) Vaanam

Jiiva was originally offered to play the male lead, but the role went to Simbu. Nayanthara was offered to play the female lead, but she refused. Anushka Shetty was then offered, but after she refused, Taapsee Pannu was offered, but she rejected as well and then Anushka agreed to play the role.

14) Thillalangadi

Madhavan was initially offered to play the male lead, but the role went to Jayam Ravi. Ileana D’Cruz who did the role in the Telugu version, was offered to play the female lead, but she refused. Bhanu was also offered, but the role finally went to Tamannah.

15) Aadukalam

Shriya Saran was offered the female lead, but she turned it down due to scheduling conflicts. Trisha was offered next, but she refused too due to scheduling conflicts. Then the role went to newcomer Taapsee Pannu.

16) Siruthai

Anushka Shetty who played the female lead in the original Telugu version, was initially offered to play the same role but she refused and the role went to Tamannah.

17) Mankatha

The role of one of Ajith’s sidekick was offered to Manoj Manchu, but he refused and the role went to Vaibhav Reddy. Ganesh Venkataraman was offered the 4th sidekick role but he refused. Nandha was also offered but he turned it down as well, and the role went to newcomer Ashwin Kakumanu. Prasanna was offered to play the role of the police officer, but he rejected due to busy schedules, and the role went to Arjun. Samantha was originally offered to play the female lead, but she refused. Actresses such as Anushka Shetty, Neetu Chandra and Lakshmi Rai were also offered, but the role finally went to Trisha. Sneha was approached to play the role opposite Arjun, but the role went to Andrea.

18) Theeratha Vilayattu Pillai

Bipasha Basu, Reemma Sen, Shriya Saran, Priyamani and Tamannah were considered for the roles of the three female roles, but the roles went to Neetu Chandra, Tanushree Dutta and newcomer Sarah Jane Dias.

19) 3

Shruti Hassan was the first choice, but she initially refused due to date clashes. The role was then offered to Amala Paul and she confirmed. But Amala Paul later backed off and Shruti Hassan agreed to play the role as her Telugu film was delayed.

20) Kandukondain Kandukondain

Prabhu Deva was initially offered to play the role of Srikanth, but he refused. Prasanth was then offered, but the role went to Abbas. Soundarya was the first option to play the role of Meenakshi, but she refused due to scheduling conflicts and the role went to Aishwarya Rai.

21) Kannathil Muthamittal

Rani Mukerji, Soundarya and Bhoomika Chawla were initially considered for the role of Indira, but the role finally went to Simran. Vikram was offered to play Dileepan, but he refused and the role went to J.D Chakravarthy.

22) Alaipayuthey

Vasundhara Das was initially offered to play the female lead, but the role went to Shalini. Vikram was offered to play Swarnamalya’s fiancee, but he refused. Shahrukh Khan, Mammooty and Mohanlal were considered for the role of Khushboo’s husband, but the role went to Arvind Swamy.

23) Kakka Kaaka

The role of the male lead first wasn’t offered to Surya. It was Ajith. But he refused. Vikram was then offered but he refused too. Jyothika suggested Surya to Gautham Menon, and hence he got the role.

24) Bharathi

The female role was first offered to Suvvalakshmi, but she refused and the role went to Devayani.

25) Sillinu Oru Kaadhal

Asin was offered to play Bhoomika Chawla’s role, but she refused and thus Bhoomika played the role.

26) Anniyan

The role of the female lead was initially offered to Aishwarya Rai, but she refused due to scheduling conflicts. Hence the role went to Sadha.

27) Vaaranam Aayiram

Deepika Padukone was first offered to play the role of Priya, was supposed to make her debut with this film, but she backed off and signed Om Shanti Om. Andrea was confirmed but was later dropped off. Asin was interested to play the role, but Surya refused since she also rejected Sillinu Oru Kadhal. Thus, the role went to Divya Spandana. Genelia D’souza was initially offered to play Sameera Reddy’s role, but she later backed off as Gautham Menon refused to play her hefty salary which she demanded. Hence the role went to Sameera Reddy, who made her debut in Tamil films.

28) Vasool Raja MBBS

Sonali Bendre, who played the female lead in the Telugu version was offered to play the role in the Tamil version, but she refused and the role went to Sneha. K.Balachandar was initially offered to play Kamal’s father, but he refused to act and Girish Karnad was finalized, but the role finally went to Nagesh.

29) Thenali

Mohanlal was offered to play Dr.Kailash and Simran was offered to play Janaki but the roles went to Jayaram and Jyothika.

30) Rhythm

Arvind Swamy was offered to play the lead role, but he backed off and the role went to Arjun.

31) Dasaavatharam

Vidya Balan was originally offered to play the female lead, and was going to make her Tamil debut with this film, but she backed off due to date clashes. Several other actresses such as Mumtaj, Kiran Rathod, Meena, Kamalinee Mukherkee, Trisha, Nayanthara, Meera Jasmine, Vasundhara Das etc. were also offered, but they all refused. Shriya Saran was forced to opt out by the producers of her film ‘Sivaji’, a film built as a rival. Then finally the role went to Asin.

32) Vishwaroopam

Initially Sonakshi Sinha was offered to play the role of Kamal’s wife, and was going to make her Tamil debut with this film. She backed off and the role went to Pooja Kumar.

33) Roja

Aishwarya, daughter of Lakshmi was offered to play the female lead, but the role went to Madhoo.

34) Anjali

Mohan was offered the male lead, but he had to opt out due to personal reasons and the role went to Raghuvaran.

35) Bombay

Vikram was offered the male lead, but he backed off as he was willing to grow a beard. Thus, the role went to Arvind Swamy.

36) Avvai Shanmughi

The role of Meena’s father was initially offered to Sivaji Ganesan, but he was ill and hence he couldn’t commit. The role went to Gemini Ganesan. Sri Durga and Sanghavi were considered for the other female role, but the role went to Heera Rajagopal.

37) Thevar Magan

Meena was initially offered to play the role of Panchavarnam, but she refused due to date problems and the role went to Revathi.

38) Iruvar

The role of Tamizhselvan was initially offered to Nana Patekar, but he refused. Actors Mammooty, Kamal Hassan, Sathyaraj and Mithun Chakraborty were also offered but they refused too. Madhavan was asked to come for a screen test but Mani Ratnam left him out as he felt that Madhavan was too young. Thus the role went to Prakash Raj.

39) Thiruda Thiruda

The role of Kadhir was first offered to J.D Chakaravarthy, but he refused and the role went to Anand.

40) Nerukku Ner

Ajith was offered to play the lead role with Vijay, but he refused due to date problems. Prabhu Deva was offered next but he refused too. Director Vasanth decided to play the role, but finally the role went to Surya, who made his debut with this film.

41) Arunachalam

Manisha Koirala and Meena were considered for the role of the female lead, but the role went to Soundarya.

42) Jodi

Aishwarya Rai was offered the female role, but she refused due to busy schedule and the role went to Simran. Aishwarya then agreed to do a guest appearance, but the role went to Isha Koppikkar.

43) Mudhalvan

The role was initially written for Rajnikanth, but he couldn’t commit. Vijay was considered, but he turned it down. Kamal Hassan was also approached but he couldn’t do it as he was doing Hey Ram that time. Thus the role went to Arjun. Meena was offered to play the female role, but she refused as she was doing another film with Arjun that period called ‘Rhythm’. Thus the role went to Manisha Koirala.

44) Gentleman

Sarathkumar was initially offered to play the lead role, but he refused and thus he was replaced by Arjun.

45) Padayappa

Simran and Meena were considered for the role of Neelambari, but the role went to Ramya Krishnan, who won the Best Actress that year. Simran was also offered to play the role of Vasundhara but the role went to Soundarya. Shalini was offered to play Padayappa’s sister, but the role went to Sithara.

46) Kaathala Kaathala

Meena and Simran were offered to play the female role opposite Prabhu Deva, but they both turned it down and the role went to Rambha. Nagma was offered to play the female role opposite Kamal Hassan but she refused as she and Rambha didn’t get along on the sets of Janakiraman. Soundarya volunteered to do the role.

47) Mouna Ragam

The role of Divya was initially offered to Nadhiya, but she couldn’t commit and hence Revathi got the role.

48) Muthal Muriyathai

The female lead was initially offered to Radhika, but she chose to do the film ‘Swati Mutyam’ and the role went to Radha.

49) Moondrum Pirai

The role of Bhagyalakshmi was first offered to Sripriya, but she couldn’t commit, hence the role went to Sridevi.

50) Rajadhi Raja

Revathi and Rubini were supposed to play the female roles, but the roles went to Radha and Nadhiya.

51) Apoorva Sagodharargal

Gandhimathi was supposed to play Manorama’s role, but due to changes in the script she was replaced.

52) Meendum Kokila

Rekha was offered the other lead, and was supposed to make her Tamil debut with this film, but she was pulled ou and the role went to Deepa.

53) Sigappu Rojakal

Sivakumar was offered to play the male lead, but he rejected as he felt the role didn’t suit him. Hence the role went to Kamal Hassan.

My last post was about Bollywood, now continuing with Hollywood. You would be surprised to know that these were the first choices for these roles.

1) Star Wars

The role of Han Solo was originally offered to Al Pacino, but he refused. Christopher Walken was also considered but the role went to Harrison Ford.

2) Pretty Woman

The role of Edward Lewis was originally offered to Christopher Reeve, Daniel Day-Lewis, Denzel Washington and Al Pacino, but they all turned it down. Finally the role went to Richard Gere. The role of the female lead was offered to Molly Ringwald,Daryl Hannah and Michelle Pfeiffer, but they refused and Julia Roberts then agreed to play.

3) Forrest Gump

The role of Forrest Gump was offered to none other than John Travolta! But he refused and the role went to Tom Hanks. Tom Hanks won his second oscar for this film.

4) Twilight

The original choice for the role of Bella was Emily Browing, but she declined. Jennifer Lawrence was also considered but the role went to Kristen Stewert. Even the role of Edward was offered to Henry Cavill, his loss was Robert Pattinson’s gain.

5) Casino Royale

The original choice for James Bond were Hugh Jackman, Sam Worthington, Henry Cavill etc. but the role ultimately went to Daniel Craig.

6) Matrix

The role of Neo was originally offered to Will Smith, but he declined. Tom Cruise was also offered but the role went to Keanu Reeves.

7) Indiana Jones

Did you know that Harrison Ford wasn’t the first choice for Indiana Jones? it was actor Tom Selleck! He was forced to choose between the two roles and decided to honour his original commitment to the TV show. Hence the role went Harrison Ford which made him popular.

8) Toy Story

The original choice for the voice of Woody was Paul Newman. But his loss was Tom Hanks’ gain.

9) Alien

The role of Ripley was originally offered to Meryl Streep, her loss was Sigourney Weaver’s gain and she was norminated for BAFTA award for the most promising newcomer.

10) Harry Potter

You would be surprised to know that the role of Hagrid was originally offered to none other than Robin Williams! His loss was Robbie Coltrane’s gain, which made him popular. Tim Roth was originally offered to play Professor Snape, but he refused and Alan Rickman played the role. After the death of Richard Harris who played the role of Dumbledore in the first two films, Ian Mckellen a.k.a Gandalf was offered the role of Dumbledore, but he couldn’t commit as he was doing ‘Lord of the Rings’, hence the role went to Michael Gambon.

11) The Notebook

The role of Allie was originally offered to Britney Spears. Several actresses such as Ashley Judd, Reese Witherspoon, Jesiccal Biel were also in the line, but the role went to Rachel McAdams.

12) Batman Returns

The role of Catwoman was originally offered to Annette Benning, but the role went to Michelle Pfeiffer.

13) Hook

The role of Captain Hook was offered to David Bowie, but his loss was Dustin Hoffman’s gain.

14) Bad Boys

Actors Dana Carvey and John Lovitz were the original choices were the leads but the roles went to Martin Lawrence and Will Smith.

15) The Breakfast Club

Nicolas Cage was first considered for the role of John Bender but they couldn’t afford his salary requirements. John Cusack was considered next but the role went to John Hughes.

16) Django Unchained

The role of Django was written for Will Smith, but he refused and the role went to Jamie Foxx.

17) Iron Man

The role of Tony Stark/Iron Man was originally offered to Tom Cruise, but he refused as he didn’t find the script strong enough. Then the role went to Robert Downey Jr.

18) 10 Things I Hate About You

Ashton Kutcher was considered for the male lead, but he lost out to Heath Ledger.

19) Titanic

Did you know that the role of Rose was offered to none other than Gwenyth Paltrow? But she lost out to Kate Winslet.

20) Hocus Pocus

The role of Max was offered to none other than Leonardo Dicaprio, but he turned down the role to star in ‘What’s Eating Gilbert Grape’. The role went to Omri Katz.

21) Batman Begins

The original choice for Bruce Wayne/Batman was David Boreanaz (Booth from Bones) but the role ultimately went to Christian Bale.

22) Pirates of the Carribean

Did you know that the role of Jack Sparrow was offered to none other than Jim Carrey? but ultimately the role went to Johnny Depp.

23) Mean Girls

Did you know that Lindsay Lohan was actually offered to play Regina George? but she turned as she she didn’t want people to base her personality off the character. Hence Rachel McAdams played the role and Lindsay Lohan played the role of Cady.

24) Spider-Man

Did you know that the role of Peter Parker/Spiderman was originally offered to Freddie Prince Jr.? but his loss was Tobey Mcguire’s gain. The role of Green Goblin was originally offered to Nicolas Cage, but he turned down and the role went to William Dafoe.

25) Iron Man 2

The role of Natasha Romanoff was originally offered to Emily Blunt. But she refused due to scheduling conflicts and the role went to Scarlett Johanssan.

26) Avatar

Both Matt Damon and Jake Gyllenhaal were considered for the role of Jake Sully but James Cameron decided to go with Sam Worthington.

27) The Blind Side

The role of Leigh Anne Touhy was originally offered to Julia Roberts, but she turned it down and Sandra Bullock got the role.

28) The Proposal

Same way, Julia Roberts was also offered the lead in ‘The Proposal’ but she passed up and the role went to Sandra Bullock.

29) The Dark Knight

The role of Harvey Dent was offered to Matt Damon, but he refused due to scheduling conflicts. The role was then played by Aaron Eackhart.

30) Boogie Knights

Leonardo DiCaprio was offered the role of Dirk Diggler, but he refused and the role went to Mark Wahlberg. Leonardo Dicaprio stated in a interview that he regretted not doing the film.

31) Brokeback Mountain

Mark Wahlberg was offered the role of Jack, but he refused and the role went to Jake Gyllenhaal.

32) Gladiator

The role of Maximus was originally offered to Mel Gibson, but he turned down the role, and hence Russell Crowe played the role.

33) The Godfather

The role of Michael Corleone wasn’t first offered to Al Pacino. It was Jack Nicholson. But Jack Nicholson refused as he thought he wouldn’t be able to play, hence Al Pacino got the role, which made him famous.

34) Ferris Bueller’s Day Off

Did you know that Johnny Depp was originally offered the lead? But he turned it down and the role went to Matthew Broderick.

35) Se7en

Brad Pitt’s part was originally offered to Denzel Washington, but he refused as he found it too dark.

36) Back to The Future

The role of Marty McFly was originally offered to ‘The Karate Kid’ star Ralph Mucchio. But he turned it down and the role went to Michael J. Fox.

37) Footloose

Tom Cruise was originally offered the role of Ren McCormack, but he turned it down as he was doing ‘All The Right Moves’. Hence the role went to Kevin Beacon.

38) A Star is Born

Did you know that the King of Rock & Roll Elvis was offered to play John Norman Howard, but he turned it down after so much demands. The role went to Kris Kristoffsen.

39) The Shawshank Redemption

Tom Hanks was first offered to play the role of Andy Dufresne, but he turned it down as he was doing ‘Forrest Gump’. The role went to Tim Robbins.

40) Basic Instinct

Michelle Pfeiffer was originally offered to play the lead, but she passed up due to sexual content. Hence, Sharon Stone did the role.

41) The Hangover

Did you know that the role of Jade the stripper was originally offered to Lindsay Lohan? But she turned it down, as she felt that it had no potential. Hence the role went to Heather Graham.

42) Speed

The role of Annie was originally offered to Halle Berry but she turned it down, and the role went to Sandra Bullock.

43) The Wizard of Oz

The role of Wizard was originally written for W.C Fields. He turned down the role for money. He was only offered $75,000 by MGM but he wanted $100,000. Hence the role went to Frank Morgan.

44) Gone With the Wind

Bette Davis was originally offered to play Scarlett O’Hara, but she turned it down and the role went to Vivien Leigh.

45) Lord of The Rings

Did you know that the role of Gandalf was originally offered to none other than Sean Connery? He passed on the role due to the length of time for filming. The role went to Ian Mckellen which made him popular.

46) Kill Bill

Kevin Costner was first offered to play the role of Bill. He opted instead to direct Open Range. The role went to David Carradine.

47) Ghost

Bruce Willis was first offered to play the role of Sam Wheat. But he turned down the role and the role went to Patrick Swayze.

48) Clueless

Sarah Michelle Geller was first offered to play the role of Cher Horowitz, but she turned it down due to scheduling conflicts. The role went to Alice Silverstone.

49) Sister Act

The role of Deloris Van Cartier was first offered to Bette Midler. But she refused and the role went to Whoopi Goldberg.

50) Edward Scissorhands

Jim Carrey was first offered the role of Edward Scissorhands, but he turned the role. Robert Downey Jr. and Tom Cruise were also considered, but the role finally went to Johnny Depp.

51) Million Dollar Baby

Sandra Bullock was first casted for the role of Maggie. She walked out after several delays and that’s when Hillary Swank did the role.

52) Precious

Helen Mirren was initially offered the role of Mrs.Weiss, but she refused and Mariah Carey played the role, which got her a lot of critical acclaim.

53) Schindler’s list

Harrison Ford was offered the male lead, but he turned it down and hence the role went to Liam Neeson.

54) Jerry Mcguire

Tom Hanks was initially offered to play the main character, but he refused as he was directing “That Thing You Do”, hence the role went to Tom Cruise.

55) American Psycho

Leonardo DiCaprio was originally offered the role of Patrick Bateman, he was ultimately pressured to drop out because his camp was worried that his “Titanic” fanbase might not have wanted to see him play such a violent tole. Hence the role went to Christian Bale.

56) Charlie’s Angels

The role of Alex Munday was initially offered to Angelina Jolie, but she turned it down. Jada Pinkett Smith and Thandie Newton were both offered as well, but they both turned it down. Finally the role went to Lucy Liu.

57) Scream

The role of Sidney Prescott was first offered to Reese Witherspoon but she turned down the role, hence the role went to Neeve Campbell.

58) Thelma and Louise

Melanie Griffith was first offered the role of Thelma, but she refused and the role went to Geena Davis.

59) The Addams Family

The role of Morticia Addams was first offered to Cher.But her loss was Angelica Huston’s gain.

60) Grease

Did you know that the role of Danny Zuko was first offered to Henry Winkler, he turned it down and the role went to John Travolta.

So wat do you think? Would these popular movies work with these original choices?

Wait for my last part of this topic, which will include Kollywood.

One important part of a film is casting. A lot of movies have become a huge hit, and the actors were also praised. But did you know they were not the original choice for these roles. Here are the list of actors who were the original choices of these popular Bollywood films.

1) Chennai Express

Did you know that Katrina Kaif was the original choice to play the role of Meenamma? But she rejected. So many other actors such as Kareena Kapoor and Asin were also in the line, but the role finally went to Deepika Padukone, and now this movie is one of the highest grossing films of Bollywood.

2) Kick

Deepika Padukone, Sonakshi Sinha, Priyanka Chopra, Anushka Sharma and Kingfisher model Angela Johnsson were all considered for the female lead, but they all rejected and the role went to Jacqueline.

3) Bang Bang!

Did you know that Shahid Kapoor was the original choice for the male lead? But he rejected and the role went to Hrithik Roshan.

4) 2 States

Originally the role of Krish was offered to Saif Ali Khan, but he refused. Then the role went to Shahrukh Khan and later he backed out. Then the roles went to both Ranbir Kapoor and Imran Khan, but later they backed off. Then Arjun Kapoor was finalized. Originally the role of Ananya was offered to Asin, Priyanka Chopra and even Anushka Sharma, then Alia Bhatt was finalized to play the role.

5) Dabangg

Did you know that Sonu Sood was originally offered to play Chulbul Pandey? but suddenly things changed and Salman Khan played Chulbul Pandey and Sonu Sood played the antagonist Chhedi Singh.

6) Ram Leela

Kareena Kapoor was originally offered to play Leela but she walked out of the film. Kareena’s loss was Deepika Padukone’s gain. Now Ram Leela is one of the highest grossing films and Ranveer and Deepika pairing has also been loved by fans.

7) Munnabhai

Did you know that Shahrukh Khan was originally offered the role of Munnabhai? Also Sanjay Dutt was offered to play Zaheer the cancer patient. Shahrukh Khan rejected due to date problems and hence Sanjay Dutt played the role of Munnabhai and the role of Zaheer went to Jimmy Shergill. Munnabhai is one of the biggest hits up to date.

8) 3 Idiots

Shahrukh Khan was also the first choice to play the role of Rancho in 3 Idiots but he rejected and Aamir Khan took over the role and is now one of the highest grossing films.

9) Dilwale Dulhaniya Le Jayenge (DDLJ)

You would be surprised to know that the original choice for the role of Raj was not Shahrukh Khan. It was Hollywood actor Tom Cruise as the story was intended to be about Indo-American affair. But Yash Chopra, father of director Aditya Chopra was not pleased with it and they changed the theme to NRI. The next choice was Saif Ali Khan, but he rejected and then Shahrukh Khan was offered. At first he rejected and then he agreed. And now DDLJ is the most successful movie of Bollywood, still running in Maratha Mandir theatre.

10) Kuch Kuch Hota Hai

The role of Tina was originally written for Twinkle Khanna but she rejected. Other actresses such as Tabu, Urmila Matondkar, Karishma Kapoor, Aishwarya Rai, Raveena Tandon, Shilpa Shetty etc were also offered but they declined. Rani Mukerji eventhough she was not offered volunteered to do it and now Kuch Kuch Hota Hai is one of the top movies.

11) Bhaag Milkha Bhaag

Did you know that actors Abhishek Bachchan and Akshay Kumar were the original choices for the role of Milkha Singh? But due to the changes of the script, Farhan Akhtar then did the role. Bhaag Milkha Bhaag is a successful film and Farhan won accolades.

12) Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara

Did you know that Ranbir Kapoor and Imran Khan were the original choices for the film? But they declined and the roles went to Hrithik Roshan and Farhan Akhtar. Abhay Deol was then added as the third lead. ZNMD is a huge hit.

13) Kal Ho Na Ho

The role of Naina was originally offered to Kareena Kapoor. But she rejected and Preity Zinta was then offered. Kal Ho Na Ho is one of the biggest blockbusters.

14) Rang De Basanti

Arjun Rampal and Arjan Bajwa were also considered as one of the male leads, but the roles went to Sharman Joshi and Siddharth.

15) Sholay

Sholay is one of the biggest blockbusters of Bollywood. But here are some unknown facts. Did you know that the original choice for the role of Gabbar Singh was Danny Denzongpa? but he rejected due to date problems and Amjad Khan was then offered to play, which made him very popular. Another fact was that Shatrughan Sinha was the original choice for Jai but Amitabh Bachchan did it, which made him popular. Pran was considered for the role of Thakur, but the role went to Sanjeev Kumar. Dharmendra was also interested in playing the role of Thakur, but director Ramesh Sippy told him that if he had played Thakur, Sanjeev Kumar would play Veeru which would be opposite Hema Malini and which Dharmendra didn’t want that, as he was trying to woo Hema Malini. Hence he did the role of Veeru.

16) Veer-Zaara

Aishwarya Rai was originally offered to play the role of lawyer Saamiya Siddiqui, but she was replaced by Rani Mukerji.

17) Dil Chahta Hai

Did you know that Aamir Khan was originally offered to play the role of Sid? but he chose to play the role of Akash. Abhishek Bachchan was then offered. After he turned it down, then the role went to Akshaye Khanna. Dil Chahta Hai is one of the biggest hits.

18) Dil To Pagal Hai

Did you know that Juhi Chawla was first offered to play the role of Nisha? But after she rejected the role went to Karishma Kapoor. Karishma also rejected twice before agreeing to play.

19) Kabhi Alvida Na Kehna

Kajol was initially offered to play the role of Maya Talwar but she rejected as she was busy with ‘Fanaa’ and hence the role went to Rani Mukerji. Also, Rani Mukerji was initially offered to play the role of Rhea Saran and later the role went to Preity Zinta.

20) Once Upon a Time in Mumbaai

Sanjay Dutt was originally offered to play the role of Sultan Mirza but the role went to Ajay Devgn.

21) Singham

Anushka Shetty, who originally played the lead in the Tamil version, was offered the lead but she strongly refused stating that she didn’t want to work in Bollywood. Hence Kajal Aggarwal got the role.

22) Delhi Belly

Did you know that Ranbir Kapoor was the first choice to play the protaganist? but he refused and Aamir Khan signed his nephew Imran Khan. Chitrangadha Singh was offered to play the lead but she backed off and the role went to Poorna Jaggannathan

23) Murder 2

Bipasha Basu was originally offered the lead but she refused. Jacqueline eventually did the role which made her popular.Bipasha was also offered the item number ‘Aa Zara’ but she refused that too and that offer went to Yana Gupta.

24) Rockstar

Did you know the original choice for Heer was Katrina Kaif? But she backed off as she had committed to Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara. Kareena Kapoor was another choice but she wasn’t allowed to work with Ranbir Kapoor as they were cousins. Diana Penty was also in the line but Imitiaz Ali suggested her for Cocktail. Nargis Fakhri was then signed.

25) Band Baaja Baaraat

Did you know that Ranbir Kapoor was originally offered to play the male lead? But he rejected and the role went to Ranveer Singh, who made his debut with this movie and thus he became popular.

26) Barfi!

Katrina Kaif was originally offered to play the role of Shruti, but she refused. Actresses Asin and Deepika Padukone were also offered but they too rejected and finally the role went to Ileana D’Cruz. Barfi! became one of the biggest hits and also was India’s official entry to the Oscars.

27) Race 2

Kareena Kapoor and Sonakshi Sinha were offered the female lead opposite Saif Ali Khan. Both refused and the role went to Deepika Padukone. Priyanka Chopra was originally offered to play the role of Omisha, but she refused and Jacqueline got it. Chitrangadha was offered to play the role of Anil Kapoor’s assistant Cherry but she refused. Amisha Patel and Mallika Sherawat were in the line for the role, and Amisha Patel finally got the role.

28) Raanjhanaa

Shahid Kapoor and Sonakshi Sinha were originally offered to play the lead but they both declined as they were working for R..Rajkumar. Dhanush was then offered the lead and thus made his Bollywood debut and Sonam Kapoor was offered the female lead.

29) Bhool Bhulaiyya

Originally Aishwarya Rai was offered to do the role of Avni/Manjulika, and Katrina Kaif was offered to play the role of Radha. Both of them turned down and the role went to Vidya Balan and Amisha Patel.

30) Tere Naam

Amisha Patel was the original choice to play the female lead. After she refused, Bhoomika Chawla, who made her debut with Bollywood played the role.

31) Chalte Chalte

Rani Mukherjee was originally offered but she initially rejected. Aishwarya Rai then agreed to play but she had to leave midway as her then boyfriend Salman Khan disrupted filming. Rani Mukherjee saved the film by eventually agreeing to play the female lead.

32) Ajnabee

The role of Neeta was originally offered to Mahek Chahal (Bigg Boss fame) but the role was given to Bipasha Basu, who made her debut in Bollywood with this film.

33) Kaho Naa.. Pyaar Hai

Kareena Kapoor was originally signed to play the female lead, but she walked out. She was then replaced by Amisha Patel. Kaho Naa.. Pyaar Hai is one of the biggest blockbusters.

34) Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam

You would be surprised to know that Aishwarya Rai wasn’t the first choice to play the role of Nandini. It was Kareena Kapoor! But Kareena Kapoor rejected the film as she was in college. Aishwarya Rai once met Sanjay Leela Bhansali and told him that she admired his work in Khamoshi: The Musical. That’s when Sanjay Leela Bhansali decided to cast Aishwarya Rai. Aishwarya Rai won the Best Actress that year.

35) Deewana

Armaan Kohli was initially offered to do Shahrukh Khan’s role, but he walked out and thus Shahrukh Khan played the role, making his debut in films.

36) Darr

The original choice for the role of Rahul was Ajay Devgn, but he turned down due to date problems. Aamir Khan was then offered but he rejected as he wasn’t happy about the way Yash Chopra directed his film ‘Parampara’. Aamir Khan recommended Shahrukh Khan to do the role as he felt he would be perfect for the role. That’s when Shahrukh Khan did the role and won the Best Villain award. Sunny Deol was offered to play both Rahul and Sunil but he chose to play Sunil.

37) Qurbani

The role of Amar was initially offered to Amitabh Bachchan, but he replied that he was only free after 6 months and Feroz Khan didn’t want to wait that long. Hence the role went to Vinod Khanna.

38) Silsila

Parveen Babi and Smita Patil were the original choices, but the roles went to Jaya Bachchan and Rekha.

39) Sadma

Dimple Kapadia was originally offered to play the lead, but the role went to Sridevi, who was also the lead in the Tamil version.

40) Deewar

Rajesh Khanna and Navin Nischol were the original choices for the role of Vijay, but the writers Salim-Javed insisted that Amitabh Bachchan would suit more. This movie gave Amitabh Bachchan the title of ‘angry young man’.Nirupa Roy’s role was originally offered to Vyjanthimala but she turned it down.

41) Anand

Did you know that Rajesh Khanna and Amitabh Bachchan weren’t the first choices? It was Kishore Kumar and Mehmood. Director Hrishikesh Mukherjee was asked to meet Kishore Kumar to discuss the project. However, when he went to Kishore Kumar’s residence, he was driven away by the gatekeeper due to a misunderstanding. Kishore Kumar who himself was a Bengali had done a stage show organized by another Bengali man, and was involved in a dispute with this man over financial matters. He had instructed his gatekeeper to drive away this “Bengali”, if he ever visited the house. The gatekeeper misunderstood Hrishikesh Mukherjee to be this “Bengali”, and refused him entry. The incident hurt him and he decided not to work with Kishore Kumar. Even Mehmood had to leave the film as well and thus Rajesh Khanna and Amitabh Bachchan got the roles.

42) Pakeezah

Ashok Kumar who played the role of Shahbuddin was originally offered to play to role of Salim, but the role went to Raaj Kumar.

43) Amar Prem

Original choice for Anand’s role was Raaj Kumar as the director Shakti Samanta felt that Rajesh Khanna who had become a super star after the hit Aradhana, wouldn’t be interested in doing a film around the female lead. However, Rajesh Khanna convinced Shakti Samanta that he would do justice to the role.

44) Aandhi

The role of Aarti Devi was originally offered to Vyjanthimala, but she turned it down. Suchitra Sen was then offered the role.

45) Gol Maal

Rekha was the original choice for the role of Urmila but then she was replaced by Bindiya Goswami.

46) Satyam Shivam Sundaram

Zeenat Aman wasn’t the first choice. It was Hema Malini and Dimple Kapadia, but both turned down as there was sexual content in the film

47) Mughal-E-Azam

Did you know that the role of Anarkali was originally offered to Suraiya? but the role went to Madhubala. Dilip Kumar was initially rejected for the role of Salim. Did you know that role of young Prince Salim was offered to Tabla maestro Zakir Hussain? but the role went to Jalal Agha. Mughal-E-Azam is a very popular film.

48) Sahib Biwi aur Ghulam

The role of Chhoti Bahu was initially offered to Nargis, but the role went to Meena Kumar, which made her popular. Shashi Kapoor was the first choice for the role of Bhoothnath, but he was later rejected as he showed up two hours later. Biswajeet was the other choice, but he refused so Guru Dutt, the producer himself decided to play the role.

49) Sangam

Initially Dilip Kumar was the first choice to play the role of Gopal Verma. He actually agreed but he had a condition, that he should be given the right to edit the final copy of the film. But Raj Kapoor didn’t agree. Dev Anand was then offered, but he rejected and finally the role went to Rajendra Kumar.

50) Jewel Thief

Saira Banu was offered the female lead, but she turned it down and the role went to Vyjanthimala.

51) Ram Aur Shyam

The roles of the female leads were originally offered to Vyjanthimala and Mala Sinha, but they turned it down and the roles went to Waheeda Rehman and Mumtaz.

52) Guide

Saira Banu and Vyjanthimala were both offered the role of the female lead. But they both turned it down and the role went to Waheeda Rehman.

53) Pyaasa

The role of Shyam was initially offered to Johnny Walker, but the role went to one of Guru Dutt’s assistant directors.

54) Mother India

The role of Birju was initally offered to Sabu Dastagir, a Hollywood star of Indian origin. However there were so many delays and hence he was dismissed. Dilip Kumar was then offered, he agreed to play both Birju and Shamu. However, Nargis objected that the public would not accept their casting as mother and son because she had done several romantic films alongside him. Then Sunil Dutt got the role. Mother India is one of the most popular films.

55) Naya Daur

Initially Madhubala was offered the lead role. An advance payment was given to her and shooting began and continued smoothly for 15 days. B.R. Chopra, the director, wanted the unit to travel to Bhopal for an extended outdoor shooting. Ataullah Khan, the father of Madhubala, objected to this and claimed that the entire Bhopal schedule was a ruse to give Dilip Kumar the opportunity to romance his daughter (Dilip Kumar and Madhubala were in a relationship at the time). Finally, B.R. Chopra sued Madhubala for the cash advance she received from him for a film she now had no intention of completing. She was replaced by Vyjanthimala.

56) Devdas (1955)

The roles of Paro and Chandramukhi were originally offered to Meena Kumari and Nargis. But Meena Kumari couldn’t do the role as her husband had some conditions which was not ok with director Bimal Roy. Bina Rai was next offered, but she refused. Suraiya also wanted the role, but the role finally went to Suchitra Sen. Nargis refused to do Chandramukhi as she wanted to play Paro. No one was willing to play Chandramukhi. Since there was no other choice, Vyjanthimala got the role.

57) Mr. & Mrs. 55

Vyjanthimala was offered the lead role, but she refused and the role went to Madhubala. In a recent interview, Vyjanthimala stated that she regretted not doing the film.

58) Zanjeer

The role was originally offered to Raaj Kumar, be he turned it down. Other actors such as Dev Anand, Dharmendra and Rajesh Khanna were also offered but they all turned it down. The role went to Amitabh Bachchan, who was then a newcomer. After this film, the Prakash Mehra and Amitabh jodi never looked back.

Do you think these movies would’ve worked if these original actors played the role?

Wait for my other two parts which will include Hollywood and Kollywood.

Hey all, so today is maestro A.R Rahman’s birthday. So i’ll be sharing some facts about A.R Rahman, some known some unknown.

1) At the age of 15, he was thrown out of school because of short attendance.

2) He was originally a Hindu by the name of A.S Dileep Kumar. He converted to Islam with the name of Allah Raka Rahman when a Pir called Sheikh Abdul Quadir cured her sister from a fatal illness.

3) Along with making music, he also has a passion for gaming. He spends his free time with his kids, Khatija, Rahima and son Ameen by playing.

4) His birthday falls on the same day as his son’s. He doesn’t believe in lavish celebrations. He visits an orphanage on his birthday and celebrates the day in peace.

5) Penguin Publishers came up with A.R Rahman’s first biography but he refused to accept it. According to him, it was considerably removed from reality.

6) In 1987, Rahman composed a music album by the name of ‘Disco Disco’ in collaboration with Tamil singer and actor Malayasia Vasudevan and another Sufi album. He also did an English album called ‘Set Me Free’ with Malgudi Shubha that was released in the beginning of 1990s.

7) His early influences were Vangelis and John Williams. Some years later, he discovered a new-found interest in jazz with Chick Corea, Dave Grusin and Herbie Hancock

8) He featured in a TV programme for kids called ‘Wonder Balloon’ on Doordarshan in 1980. Playing four keyboards on TV was an exhilarating experience for Rahman and people began to recognise him.

9) He wanted to become a computer engineer. “I wanted to be a computer engineer when I was a kid. Electronic gadgets and technology fascinated me.”

10) The world knows that his first film is “Roja”. But this is not true. His first film was “Yodha”. This film starred Mohanlal in Malayalam.

11) He has lot of interests towards Social service. He loves doing that without any kind of fame.

12) During important film festivals Rahman is very conscious about his wardrobe. His wife Saira and a Mumbai based designer Deepak decides about his dresses.

13) The old keyboard that he used to play as a teenager is still displayed in his studio.

14) During the composition of a film Rahman sings “Pudhiya vaanam Pudhiya bhoomi engum pani mazhai pozhigiradhu” loudly which indicates that all the works related to him is done.

15) Director Mani Ratnam is the only person who can meet Rahman at any time of his choice.

16) He talks very less. But to the close friends circle Rahman just loves to talk and laugh. “Music is the tool through which he keeps on speaking.”

17) He likes listening to songs based on the Raag Sindhu Bhairavi.

18) When filmmaker Subhash Ghai once told A.R Rahman during the music of Taal that he would once win an Oscar, he laughed aloud and replied that he could not.

19) A,R Rahman’s award winning song “Jai Ho” was initially composed for the movie ‘Yuvvraaj’. But it later became a part of ‘Slumdog Millionaire’.

20) His album “Couples Retreat” bagged more than 100 million dollars. This Hollywood movie has a tamil song as well.

21) A.R Rahman is the only Indian to be featured in ‘List of best-selling music artists of the world’

22) He does not let his wife or children inside the studio when he’s working.

23) He usually sees his children off to school before he sleeps after working nights!

24) He goes to Hyderabad and Nagoor Dhargas with his family atleast once in 6 months.

25) He loves to shop for music records at the Virgin Records store in New York. Once he landed in NY at 2 a.m and dashed off to the store right away.

26) He has 0% affinity towards gold jewellery. Slim Platinum ring is what he wears at times. He doesnt wear a watch in his hand.

27) He doesn’t go to any kind of recreational places like theatres and parties. When he gets free time he just spends it with his family.

28) A.R Rahman has no nick names. All the family members including sisters and his mom call him ‘Rahman’ with full fledged love and affection.

29) Saira Banu is the sister-in-law of Tamil actor Rahman and the daughter of a Chennai-based businessman from Kutch.

30) A.R Rahman’s mother spotted Saira at a dargah and sent a marriage proposal right away!

31) He adds lots of sugar in his cup of coffee. The ratio is 1/4 of the size of the cup. People are amazed when they share a cup in his house.

32) Actress Freida Pinto and Sonam Kapoor helped AR Rahman land some prized international projects. “It was sweet of Freida Pinto to recommend me to Julian Schnabel for Miral. I was keen to write new music for him but he insisted on using ‘The Bombay Theme’ and a track from He Ping’s Warriors of Heaven and Earth.” Rahman later says: “Danny (Boyle) told me later that it was Anil Kapoor and his kids who had recommended me to him. They would play him my songs and then the sound recordist Resul Pukkutty, also played my music to him.”

33) He might have a lot of fans but Rahman’s daughter Khatija doesn’t like her dad signing autographs in school and has even asked him not to come there.

34) He studied at Trinity college of Music at OXFORD University.

35) His love and divine respect for music brought him and our India two Oscars proudly.

36) A.R Rahman will be soon producing films also, but apart from having his International standard he said that he will be producing only Hindi, Tamil and Telugu films.

37) Vande Mataram, an album of his original compositions released on India’s 50th anniversary of independence in 1997, enjoyed great commercial success.

38) He has provided the scores for many successful Hollywood films, including 127 Hours in 2010, ‘Slumdog Millionaire’ in 2008, and ‘Lord of War’ in 2005.

39) AR Rahman’s father was a composer and arranger in Malyalam movies.ARahman was 9, when his father passed away. He joined Illaiyaraja’s troupe as a keyboard player to earn for his family.

40) A.R Rahman was 9, when his father passed away. He joined Illaiyaraja’s troupe as a keyboard player to earn for his family.

41) In 2006, he launched his own music label KM Music

42) In 2004, he was appointed as a Global Brand ambassador of the Stop TB Partnership, a project by WHO.

43) He has been honored with the Padma Bhushan award and Padma Shri award from the Government of India

44) In 2007, A.R Rahman was entered in the Limca Books of Awards as “Indian of the Year for Contribution to Popular Music”

45) He lives in a small two-storey bungalow in Kodambakkam.

46) A R Rahman was a keyboardist in a band called Nemesis Avenue along with singer Suresh Peters.

47) A.R Rahman also composed jingles for ads.

Check this jingle, my all time favourite

48) When on concert tours abroad, A.R Rahman does not waste time sight-seeing. He is just engrossed in his music.

49) A.R Rahman was also part of Roots, a band with now famous percussionist Anandan Sivamani.

50) A.R Rahman likes to record music only in the night, but he makes an exception for the legendary Lata Mangeshkar.

51) The music maestro prefers to give newcomers a chance – singers who are melodious but not necessarily well-trained.

52) The Jai Ho composer religiously performs namaz five times a day.

53) A.R Rahman trained under veteran Master Dhanraj.

54) A.R Rahman’s father R K Shekhar was a music composer and conductor for Malayalam films.

55) His father bought him a keyboard from Singapore and a young Rahman was hooked to it.

So what is your favourite A.R Rahman album? Can choose 3 favourites and u can also add a favourite that’s been missed in the list..

Today I would be posting about the list of real life married couples who acted in a film together. This list will include Hollywood, Bollywood and Kollywood. Check it out!

Hollywood

1) Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie

‘Brangelina’ who are the no.1 pair worldwide, acted together in the film ‘Mr. and Mrs. Smith’, where they first met. During that time, Brad Pitt was still married to Jennifer Aniston. Later, they got together and share 6 children.

2) Channing Tatum and Jenna Dewan – Tatum

Channing Tatum and Jenna Dewan – Tatum acted together in the film ‘Step Up’, where they first met. They got married in 2009 and in 2011, they starred together in the film ’10 years’.

3) Will Smith and Jada Pinkett Smith

Will Smith and Jada Pinkett Smith acted together in the film ‘Ali’, a movie about Muhammad Ali the boxer. They had originally met in the set of ‘The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air’, when Jada originally auditioned for the role of Lisa.

4) Annette Benning and Warren Beaty

Annette Benning and Warren Beaty acted together in the films ‘Love Affair’ and ‘Bugsy’. They met on the sets of ‘Bugsy’ and got married in 1992.

5) Ben Stiller and Christine Taylor

Ben Stiller and Christine Taylor acted together in the films ‘Zoolander’ and ‘Dodgeball’ (not opposite each other). They met in the set of a pilot in 1999 and got married in 2000.

6) Kristen Bell and Dax Shepard

Kristen Bell and Dax Shepard met together in the sets of ‘When In Rome’ and also acted in the film ‘Hit and Run’. They got married in 2013 and got 2 kids.

7) Ryan Reynolds and Blake Lively

Ryan Reynolds and Blake Lively met in the sets of ‘The Green Lantern’. After Ryan’s divorce with Scarlett Johanssan, he married Blake Lively in 2012.

8) Jennifer Garner and Ben Affleck

Jennifer Garner and Ben Affleck acted in the films ‘Pearl Harbour’ and ‘Daredevil’. They got married in 2005.

9) Anna Faris and Chris Pratt

Anna Faris and Chris Pratt met on the sets of ‘Take Me Home Tonight’. They got married in 2009.

10) Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson

Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson acted in the film ‘Volunteers’. They first met on the sets of the TV show ‘Bosom Buddies’. They got married in 1988.

11) Freddie Prince Jr. and Sarah Michelle Geller

Freddie Prince Jr. and Sarah Michelle Geller acted in the film ‘Scooby Doo’.

Bollywood

1) Amitabh and Jaya Bachchan

Amitabh and Jaya acted in various movies such as ‘Silsila’, ‘Zanjeer’, ‘Abhimaan’, ‘Sholay’ etc. They were last seen together in the film ‘Kabhi Khushi Kabhi Gham’.

2) Dharmendra and Hema Malini

Dharmendra and Hema Malini acted in various such as ‘Sholay’, ‘Dream Girl’, ‘Seeta Aur Geeta’, ‘Pratiggya’ etc.

3) Rishi Kapoor and Neetu Singh

Rishi Kapoor and Neetu Singh starred in various films such as ‘Rafoo Chakkar’, ‘Amar Akbar Anthony’, ‘Pati Patni Aur Woh’, ‘Kabhie Kabhie’ etc.

4) Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan

Abhishek and Aishwarya starred in films like ‘Dhai Akshar Prem Ke’, ‘Kuch Na Kaho’, ‘Guru’, ‘Dhoom 2’, ‘Raavan’ etc.

5) Akshay Kumar and Twinkle Khanna

Akshay and Twinkle starred in two films :- ‘International Khiladi’ and ‘Zulmi’.

6) Ajay Devgn and Kajol

Ajay and Kajol acted in various movies like ‘Hulchul’, ‘Ishq’, ‘Pyar To Hona Hi Tha’, ‘Dil Kya Kare’, ‘U, Me Aur Hum’, ‘Toonpur Ka Superhero’ etc.

7) Saif Ali Khan and Kareena Kapoor

Saif and Kareena did movies like Tashan, Kurbaan and Agent Vinod. While they weren’t dating, they both acted in Omkara.

8) Riteish Deshmukh and Genelia D’souza

Riteish and Genelia both debuted in ‘Tujhe Meri Kasam’. Then they did ‘Masti’ together and now recently ‘Tere Naal Love Ho Gaya’.

9) Dilip Kumar and Saira Banu

Dilip and Saira acted in the film ‘Bairaag’.

10) Sunil Dutt and Nargis

Sunil Dutt and Nargis acted in the film ‘Mother India’ where Sunil Dutt played Nargis’ son.

11) Dev Anand and Kalpana Kartik

Dev Anand and Kalpana Kartik acted in films ‘Taxi Driver’, ‘Nau Do Gyarah’, ‘House No.44’, ‘Baazi’ and ‘Bhoole Bisre Geet’.

12) Kishore Kumar and Madhubala

Kishore Kumar and Madhubala acted in films like ‘Half Ticket’ and ‘Chalti Ka Naam Gaadi’. They were together till Madhubala’s death.

13) Shammi Kapoor and Geeta Bali

Shammi Kapoor and Geeta Bali acted in films like ‘Jab Se Tumhe Dekha Hai’ and ‘Miss Coco Cola’. They were together till Geeta Bali’s death.

14) Vinod Mehra and Bindiya Goswami

Vinod Mehra and Bindiya Goswami acted in films like ‘Khud-dhar’, ‘Chor Police’, ‘Jaane Dushman’ etc. They divorced later.

15) Randhir Kapoor and Babita

Randhir Kapoor and Babita acted in the film ‘Kal Aaj Aur Kal’.

16) Shashi Kapoor and Jennifer Kendal

Shashi Kapoor and Jennifer Kendal acted in the film ‘Junoon’.

Kollywood

1) Surya and Jyothika

Surya and Jyothika acted in various films such as ‘Kaakha Kaakha’, ‘Perazhagan’, ‘Maayavi’, ‘Sillinu Oru Kadhal’ etc.

2) Ajith and Shalini

Ajith and Shalini acted in the film ‘Amarkalam’.

3) Bhagyaraj and Poornima

Bhagyaraj and Poornima acted in the films ‘Mundhanai Mudichu’ and ‘Darling, Darling, Darling’.

4) Saranya and Ponvannan

Saranya and Ponvannan acted in the films ‘Pulliman’, ‘Pasumpon’ and ‘Karuththamma.’

5) R.Sarathkumar and Raadhika

Sarath Kumar and Raadhika acted in films like ‘Namma Annachi’, ‘Thenkasi Pattanam’, ‘Suryavamsam’ etc.

6) Sneha and Prasanna

Sneha and Prasanna starred together in the film ‘Acchamundu! Acchamundu!’

7) Gemini Ganesan and Savitri

Gemini Ganesan and Savitri acted in the films ‘Kandan Karunai’, ‘Kalathur Kanmamma’ etc.

8) Gemini Ganesan and Pushpavalli

Gemini Ganesan and his third wife Pushpavalli also did a film ‘Miss Malini’.
